entry.title: asset history sheet
entry.content:
Hello experts ,

Are you able to explain to us, what the difference between both Axis Properties "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" is in APP _: asset history sheet in sap public cloud .

 

 

I'm asking because I'm still trying to find the right way to present data in "Asset History Sheet". This report should include only active assets as well as assets deactivated within the reporting fiscal year.

 

The main deactivation ways are as follows:

  • transfer from Asset under Construction to a fixed asset & closing of an investment WBS Element;
  • scrapping;
  • sale to 3rd party;
  • sale between IC companies.

 

For all retirement types – aside from IC sale – the standard AHS-Report with "None" Axis Properties is quite understandable: only assets deactivated after the cutover for balance carryforward in mid-December are moved to the report for the new year.

But when it comes to the asset IC sale, there is a bug that we can't get trustworthy explained by SAP, for example: in the AHS for October '25, we still see lots of assets sold internally in 2023 (e.g. 20000245-0, 30002028-0) and in 2024 (e.g. 30000856-0, 60000928-0).

 

I thought that maybe another display ("Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based") could be useful.

Indeed, assets deactivated in previous years aren't shown there, but at the same time assets acquired and retired in the current year are missing there too, even if they haven’t been deactivated yet

 

 

 

The number of displayed columns is also limited in "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" displays in comparison to “None” and seems not to include those whose values are zero, e.g. missing important column "Net Book Value at Reporting Date" in the file for some IT equipment.

 

Is there any other possibility to solve the issue with presentation of assets deactivated in previous fiscal years (without manipulating the filters on deactivation date)?

entry.title: Re: Error during Goods Receipt Reversal
entry.content:
The error “Inspection Lot was partly posted” means that the inspection lot created during the original goods receipt has already had some postings (such as usage decisions or partial stock postings). In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, once an inspection lot is partly processed, you cannot directly reverse the goods receipt. Instead, you must first reverse or cancel the inspection lot postings (e.g., usage decision, stock postings) before attempting the GR reversal

Why because when you post a goods receipt for a purchase order with QM active, SAP automatically creates an inspection lot. If you move stock from quality inspection to unrestricted, scrap, or any other status, the inspection lot is considered partly posted. The reversal process checks the inspection lot status. If it is not fully open (status CRTD), reversal is blocked.

To resolve this, perform the below steps

  • Use transaction QA32 (Manage Inspection Lots) or the Fiori app Manage Inspection Lots. Verify if a usage decision or partial stock posting has already been made.
  • If stock was moved from quality inspection to unrestricted or blocked, you need to reverse those material movements first either via MBST or Fiori Cancel Material Documents. If a usage decision was made, you must cancel it (if allowed) or adjust the stock postings accordingly.
  • Ensure all quantities are back in the quality inspection stock type. The inspection lot should be in CRTD status (no postings).
  • Once the inspection lot is clean, use the Reverse Goods Receipt app or API in Public Cloud to cancel the GR

entry.title: Business ByDesign - Migration from SAP Intelligent RPA to SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Dear Community,

In upcoming releases, we will introduce a streamlined process to upgrade an existing Intelligent RPA tenant into a Build Process Automation tenant with just a few steps. This means you won’t need to export and import projects between tenants, nor redeploy, create triggers, register agents, and perform other manual tasks.

Below steps are required to transform an Intelligent RPA tenant to a Build Process Automation tenant.

Pre-requisites

To ensure a smooth and effortless migration, we provide in-place migration capabilities. However, certain requirements must be met to prevent data loss and incomplete transformations.

Steps to be followed - Click on "Enable migration" 

Connect IRPA Factory. A new tile should be displayed.

 

 

The button "Enable Migration" would be shown. Click and a confirmation is required.

 

 

Note

  • The following actions must be completed by 30th November 2025

  • Impact if the migration flag is not enabled:
    We will enforce the migration flag during the 2602 upgrade.

  • If Intelligent RPA is already enabled but not actively used, you have two options:

    • Descope the feature from Business Configuration
    • Enable Migration

Additional resources

Introducing-in-place-migration-from-sap-intelligent-rpa-to-sap-build

sap-business-bydesign-the-irpa-road-to-sap-build-process-automation

entry.title: Missing "Payment details" tag in XML Facturae (public entity) - DRC SAP PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are working in this XML: ?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><fe:Facturae xmlns:fe="http://www.facturae.es/Facturae/2009/v3.2/Facturae">

We were trying to send an XML file to FACe. The procedure is now correct, and we can download the XML file and upload it to the FACe website (Spain).

Upon reviewing and comparing the format (with an older version of the client's ERP), we discovered that the <PaymentDetails> tag is missing. This tag contains the bank details where the company wishes to receive payment from the public entity.

Do I need to configure anything else for this bank information to appear in the XML file? I couldn't find any information on this. I tried including the bank details when creating the invoice and also added a custom bank to a business partner's profile, but nothing worked.

I followed the step by step from this website information: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/93f1698548a14c09947d53fbc1c3423a.html?locale=es-ES&version=2502.500

Thanks for the help!

entry.title: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of text for custom ValueList (CAP / OData V4)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a CAP (Node.js) + Fiori Elements V4 application on SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry). In a List Report for ProductReviews, I have a filter field Product Manager that uses a custom Value Help (ValueList) based on a projection entity ProductManagerEntities.

Problem: In the Value Help dialog, the table correctly shows the Full Name of the product managers, but in the "Selected Items and Conditions" section at the bottom, the token shows the GUID (ID) instead of the full name.

I would like the token to display the full name, not the ID.

Environment

  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry
  • CAP (Node.js), OData V4
  • Fiori Elements V4 – List Report / Object Page
  • UI5 version (launchpad): 1.13x / 1.14x (dev launchpad)
  • Service: GlobalAssetPortalService

Data Model (simplified)

db/schema.cds

entity ProductReviews : cuid, managed {
  product : Association to one Products not null;

  @Common.FilterDefaultValue: 'OPEN'
  status  : String enum {
    OPEN;
    COMPLETED;
  } default 'OPEN';
}

entity ProductManagerEntities as
  select from ProductReviews distinct {
    key product.productManager.ID as productManagerId,
    key product.productManager.ID as ID,
    product.productManager as productManager,
    (product.productManager.firstName || ' ' || product.productManager.lastName) as fullName : String,
    product.productManager.mail  as mail,
    product.productManager.phone as phone
  } where status = 'OPEN';

Service Projections

srv/gap-service.cds

@cds.redirection.target: false
entity ProductReviews as projection on my.ProductReviews {
    *,
    key product.ID as productId : UUID @title: '{i18n>lblProductNumber}',
    product.productManager.ID as productManagerId : String @title: '{i18n>lblProductManager}',
    product.productManager as productManager
};

@cds.redirection.target: false
entity ProductManagerEntities as projection on my.ProductManagerEntities {
    *
};

Annotations for List Report / Value Help

app/productreviews/annotations.cds

using GlobalAssetPortalService as service from '../../srv/gap-service';

annotate service.ProductReviews with @UI.HeaderInfo: {
    Title         : '{i18n>lblProductReviewTitle}',
    TypeNamePlural: '{i18n>lblProductReviewTitle}'
};

annotate service.ProductReviews with @(
    UI.SelectionFields: [ productManager_ID ]
);

// LineItem: Product Number navigates to Products app via IBN
annotate service.ProductReviews with @UI.LineItem: [
    {
        $Type         : 'UI.DataFieldWithIntentBasedNavigation',
        Label         : '{i18n>lblProductNumber}',
        Value         : productId,
        SemanticObject: 'products',
        Action        : 'display',
        Mapping       : [{
            $Type                 : 'Common.SemanticObjectMappingType',
            LocalProperty         : productId,
            SemanticObjectProperty: 'ID',
        }]
    },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productName },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productManager_ID },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productStatus_code }
]
{
    productManagerId @UI.ExcludeFromNavigationContext: true @UI.HiddenFilter;

    // Text for Product Number works fine in the list
    productId @(
        Common.Text                    : product.productNumber,
        Common.Text.@UI.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    );

    // Value Help for Product Manager filter
    productManager @(
        Common.Text            : fullName,
        Common.TextArrangement : #TextOnly,
        Common.ValueList: {
            $Type         : 'Common.ValueListType',
            CollectionPath: 'ProductManagerEntities',
            Parameters    : [
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterInOut',
                    LocalDataProperty: productManager_ID,
                    ValueListProperty: 'productManagerId'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'fullName'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'mail'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'phone'
                }
            ]
        },
        Common.ValueListWithFixedValues: false
    );
};

Current Behaviour

  • In the Value Help dialog for Product Manager, the table shows fullName correctly.
  • In the Selected Items and Conditions area, the selected token still displays the GUID (productManagerId) instead of fullName.

Expected Behaviour

When the user selects a product manager in the Value Help, the filter value (token) in Selected Items and Conditions should display the full name, e.g. Markus Kellermeyer, while the underlying technical value used for filtering remains the GUID (productManagerId).

What I Already Considered

  1. Setting @Common.Text on the association productManager (see code above).
  2. Using TextArrangement: #TextOnly.
  3. Making sure fullName is part of the ValueList parameters as DisplayOnly.

However, the token still shows the raw GUID.

Questions

  1. For a custom ValueList (CAP projection entity), where exactly should I put the @Common.Text annotation so that the "Selected Items and Conditions" token uses fullName instead of the GUID?
    For example, would this be the correct place:
    annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    productManagerId @Common: {
        Text           : fullName,
        TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    };
};
  2. Is there any special requirement in Fiori Elements V4 for filter fields using value helps so that the token displays text instead of ID?
  3. Is there a minimal example or official documentation that shows the recommended way of doing this with a custom ValueList entity in CAP + Fiori Elements V4?

Any hints, examples, or best practices for this scenario would be highly appreciated. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Mass changes to purchasing contracts, delete price co...
entry.content:
The Excel template includes a Deletion Indicator column, but this is not yet enabled for processing in the backend logic of the mass change app. SAP documentation Mass Changes to Purchase Contracts  confirms that "Using the offline mode, you can create, update, and delete multiple purchase contracts and purchase contract items in one go using Microsoft Excel". However, the deletion capability applies to contracts/items, not to individual condition records. When you mark a condition for deletion in Excel, the system does not recognize it as a change because the condition group ID and validity remain intact, so the upload logic treats it as “no change".

So you have the below options

Use the Manage Purchasing Contracts Fiori app to delete the condition record directly. This is the only supported way right now.

Instead of deleting, you can set the condition value to 0 or adjust validity dates to effectively deactivate the condition. This ensures the condition is no longer applied, even though it remains in the contract.

entry.title: Re: Switch debug user via ADT shows popup /H_REACTIVATE_EXTD_DBG KIND=USER USER=SAP_WFRT
entry.content:
Hello Sandra,

my colleague from the ABAP Kernel team made a correction for this. The special ok-code will be absorbed, so that it does not reach the processing of ST05 (or any other transaction). It is planned to be a part of the next ABAP kernel release. It is also considered for a kernel patch, but currently ranked as low priority. So it is currently not clear whether this correction will be available as a kernel patch or not.

Best regards,
Armin

entry.title: Re: DRC Fiori -Run Statutory Reports-app - Task created b...
entry.content: Hello - thanks, the storage category is already maintained - I get the message that the Report Task is created, however a Warning message appears with No Data. FI data and basic tax customizing are correct from a business point of view (DE→DE for the VAT return; DE→FR, VAT ID, EU code 4 for the ECSL). The DRC customizing for the reports from 2025 onwards is complete and consistent (periodicity, activity keys, org unit assignment, parameters). Nevertheless, both reports (DE_VAT_ADV_RTN, DE_ECSL_DCL) in the Run Statutory Reports app always return “No data”, do not create a RUN, and only appear as “inconsistent tasks” without RUN_ID in the Cleaner. SLG1 only shows Gateway logging, no SRF errors, i.e. there is no obvious technical crash, but rather a systematic “zero data” situation from the SRF runtime perspective.

entry.title: Transaktion ZFV60: unterschiedliche Fehlermeldung im Test- und Produktivsystem
entry.content:
Hallo zusammen,

ich habe ein kurioses Problem in Zusammenhang mit der Transaktion ZVF60 (Kreditorenrechnung vorerfassen). Ich möchte einen Beleg den gleichen Beleg buchen, der das Buchungsdatum von März 2025 hat. Die Periode ist für beide Systeme geschlossen. Das Produktivsystem wurde vor kurzem auf das Testsystem gespiegelt, somit sind die Systeme identisch und die Periodeneinstellungen gleich. Im Testsystem bekomme ich die Fehlermeldung F5286: "Periode 003/2025 ist für Kontoart K und Hauptbuch 251150 nicht geöffnet", im Produktivsystem bekomme ich die Fehlermeldung F5201: Buchungszeitraum 003 2025 ist nicht geöffnet. Hat jemand eine Idee, warum die Fehlermeldungen unterschiedlich sind bei gleichem Customizing?

Vielen Dank.

Viele Grüße

Nadine

entry.title: How to Mass Delete Wrong PIR Validity Period After Incorrect Mass Upload
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

User accidentally uploaded incorrect PIR validity periods in bulk using our internal program mass upload of new validity period
Example mistake: validity start 20251101 to validity end 20251231 with price = 0.
Even after re-uploading the correct PIR, the wrong validity period still appears when I download the PIR again.

Question:
Is there a standard SAP method or mass maintenance transaction to delete / remove a specific validity period for multiple PIR condition records without manual editing one by one in ME12?

I have tried:

  • Re-uploading PIR with new validity period (did not remove old one) it just added a new entry

  • MEK2 / MEK3 → still shows old period

  • Manual delete in ME12 works but not feasible for volume

Requirement:
Delete all PIR validity periods that match:

  • Validity Start = 2025.11.01

  • Validity End = 2025.12.31

  • Price = 0
    …so that these wrong records do not appear when running the next PIR download.

Any suggestion?

  • Mass deletion via MEK2 (delete indicator)?

  • Using MASS for table KONH/KONP?

  • Is LSMW / BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS a better approach?

  • Or must we change the delete indicator field only?

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to Prevent Shipping Costs from Being Distributed...
entry.content:
Good day @Husi 

Thank you for your question.

Please review these references for more details:

KBA 3618341, Distribution Between Header and Items, Header Level, Header and Item Conditions

So, the answer to your question is no, not in cloud when you use standard pricing. You have the option to either proportionally distribute the cost or have the same amount copied to each item. What you are currently experiencing is a public cloud restriction. Freight surcharge at the header as you mentioned are only a convenience UI. Considering your total freight is distributed proportionally to the items, that indicates your condition type is marked as Group Condition. If it is not marked as Group Condition, then the same freight amount will be copied to each item, which you also don’t want.

To summarise, depending on your business case, if you want to see freight only once in the document, you should consider:

  • Keeping your current distribution but adjust forms to show only the header total, or
  • Replacing the header freight condition with a separate freight item in your sales order, which then appears once and posts to a freight revenue account you dedicate, or
  • Making use of TM-based charge management, where your freight is managed and posted separately.

So, from the public clouds clean-core perspective, the simplest way for you to ensure freight appears only once without relying on the header distribution is to model your freight as a dedicated sales order item.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Internal error in FORM/FUNCTION ckms_buffer_write in...
entry.content:
In OMSY just make check box on ABp, Make sure you have maintain posting period variant in transaction OBY6 for your company code. 
Standered Posting Period variant is 0001. 
If 0001 is not there you can check for existing one  through transaction code OB52. Take any existing one which is correctly configured and enter in OBY6 for your company code.

Regards,
Lalit J

entry.title: Carrer Restart
entry.content:
Hi friends,

I was a former SAP consultant working in the IS-Retail and SD domain with an experience of 4.5 years . I was passionate about the EV transition and attended an event three years ago, which actually rekindled my excitement again. So, I left my job and started my own startup. However, as this market is mainly dominated by China, there is hardly any scope left for India. I built a SaaS product, raised funds, and got some customers, but unfortunately, the startup failed. I'm not getting hired in the EV domain because of the lack of relevant skills, and I'm barely left with any personal runway for survival. I'm in real trouble and don't know what to do with my career. Should I stay in the Emobility domain or come back to SAP consulting by learning some courses? Please guide me, as I'm at a difficult stage in my career where every day matters for me.

Thanks

RISE with SAP SAP S/4HANA SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Hello @Chris1973,

thanks for you comment. I read the SAP help articels but it seems to be set up correctly.

"First, can you check if your BOM component staging indicator is set to 2 (which releases Order Part) or 3 (which creates Part)? If not, that might explain why your proposal quantity delivers 0."

This is a screenshot of the exact PSA, the Production Order is using. The staging indicator is set to 3 and it is supposed to calculcate the quantities bases on the PMR. I did not fill out any other quantities in that line.

Your second check "make sure you confirm that the component is linked to a Supply Area in the routing. If it is not, then your demand cannot be calculated." can also be seen in that screenshot as I don't have a product specified, so it should work for all the components in the Production order.

"Third, please check if your work center, supply area, EWM staging area is mapped end-to-end. If your staging bin cannot be determined, then your proposal will equal 0" - checked it - should be fine. And the configuration should be working as the PMR looks correct.

"Fourth, your PMR needs to be ready for staging because only then does the automatic job pick it. Your status seems set to “Not begun” or “Released”, if I understood that correctly, then your proposal will be 0 because staging is not ready."

The PMR status for completion is "not started" - but isn't that correct? I haven't started the picking yet. The sttaus of the prudction order is "Released" as I can see in the PMR itself. Otherwise the PMR wouldn't have been created either.

Kind regards

Jan

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of...
entry.content:
@ncrim7 

You need to add this annotation to your ProductManagerEntities:

annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    @Common.Text: fullName
    @Common.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    ID
};

The @Common.Text annotation on the ID field of the ValueList entity itself is what makes Fiori Elements display text instead of GUID in filter tokens.

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) – Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


I’m working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I’ve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:


1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?


From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
• The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
• The user receives no error or warning
• The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?


Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?


Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: SAC Story: How to filter a chart on another page based on pie-chart segment selection?
entry.content:

I am working on an SAC Story with two separate pages:

  • Page 2: A column chart showing monthly values (Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr...) for each material

I want this behavior:

When a user selects a segment of the pie chart on Page 1 (i.e., selects a Material or multiple material), the column chart on Page 2 should automatically update and show the corresponding monthly values for that selected material.

Keeping both charts on the same page is not an option in my case.

Is there any way to achieve this in an SAC Story—either through Linked Analysis, Story Filters, Input Controls, or any other method?
If this is only possible through scripting, please help me with the script. 

 

Thank you

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) – Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


I’m working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I’ve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:

1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?

From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
• The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
• The user receives no error or warning
• The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?

Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?

Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: Unlock What’s New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series
entry.content:
Unlock What’s New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series

The 2025 release of SAP Cloud ERP Private brings powerful innovations across every line of business with an AI-First, Suite-First strategy by integrating applications, data, and AI — from a strengthened core to embedded AI and intelligent agents that transform how work gets done.

Your customers can join us December 8-11 in our exclusive deep-dive webinar series to discover how these new features provide tangible innovation impact across your key lines of business (Sales, Procurement, Finance, Manufacturing/ R&D/ Supply Chain).

Customers can Register today to stay ahead with the latest innovations from SAP Cloud ERP Private.

Why should your customer attend?

Core Highlights:

  • Embedded AI: AI is integrated across key processes in your LoBs bringing precision and predictability to every decision.
  • Role-Aware Assistant: Joule is evolving into a role-aware assistant, tailoring insights and actions to each user’s responsibilities.
  • AI-Ready Data: Help businesses manage, analyze, and leverage their data with over 130 pre-delivered data products, accelerating decision-making.

LoB Highlights:

  • Finance: Achieve real-time profitability insight using universal parallel accounting and improve your cashflow with receivables and payables financing integrated with SAP Taulia. Improve liquidity with specialized agents like the Accounts Receivable Agent and shorten resolution cycle with the Dispute Management Agent.
  • Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Ensure faster, more reliable order fulfillment using the enhanced advanced available-to-promise (ATP) capability. Optimize warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning.
  • Asset and Service: Improve equipment reliability and reduce downtime. The Maintenance Planner Agent recommends maintenance events and coordinates schedules based on interconnected data.
  • Procurement: Use Joule to simplify the creation of self-service purchase requisition and benefit from migration reports to transition to Lean Services.
  • Sales: Streamlines sales operations with AI-assisted sales order fulfillment and solution quotation creation. Explore how enhanced sales order and returns order management increase efficiency.

How to invite your Customers

  • Link to further topic Information (Links required)
  • Email Invitation - use this email template to send to your customers inviting them to the session
  • Direct Registration Link


For further questions, reach out to Architha Aravindakshan

entry.title: Re: Cannot find custom G/L acct under default transport r...
entry.content:
Hello @khanhlynx99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following link. It explains how the transports and the required business configuration flows. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/1a02302321054e6ab4d9e7244156d31b.html?locale=en-US

Based on your screenshots and details, you cannot create G/L accounts through the Manage G/L Account Master Data app in public cloud. Transport requests do not capture that either. The reason is G/L master data is part of Business Configuration content and not to technical customising which is transported through the Export Customising Transports App. Therefore, you will not see any popup when you create G/L account, system will not add any entries to DEFAULT_CUST/CUSY and your G/L account will not appear in any transport request.

To summarise, in public cloud G/L account master data is transferred to the test and production system when you activate content and not through customer transports. Ony configuration items that are maintained through SSCUIs for example Automatic Account Determination can generate transport entries. This is the reason why you only see that activity in your Export Customizing Transports App.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BRf+ - OPD Transition Help Condition Determination
entry.content:
Dear @GAK1,

Could you clarify your question, customer number?

My suggestion is based on additional fields, with this EDI vs FORM custom field approach you actually never maintain customer numbers directly in OPD.
All customer-specific logic goes into the new BP field; OPD only reads the value of that field.

For every customer:

  1. Open Manage Customer Master Data
  2. Go to the General data or where you enabled the field.
  3. You’ll see your new Output Channel (EDI/FORM) field.
  4. Set:
    • EDI for EDI customers.
    • FORM or leave empty for paper/email customers.
  5. Save.

From now on:

  • OPD reads this field via Condition Parameters of Application.
  • You never touch customer numbers in OPD just this one custom field on the BP.

Bet Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Academic Community Conference EMEA 2025
entry.content:
The SAP Academic Community Conference EMEA 2025 took place in sunny Athens and we counted with the presence of 120+ participants from 85+ academic institutions from across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
This year's Academic Partner was the Athens University of Economics and Business and during this full 3-day event. We held sessions about innovative learning and explored future roadmaps for upskilling while 'drawing the future' of learning and education to remain at the forefront of building future-ready skills. Plenary and breakout sessions were designed with interaction and engagement in mind. There were fantastic community sessions with scientific and practical contributions.

BIG thank you to the 25+ speakers and panelists covering topics on shaping the next chapter of multidimensional education.
BIG thanks to professors from AUEB George Doukidis, George Ioannou, Angeliki Poulymenakou, Ioannis Nikolaou, and their team. Thanks to the HEC Montreal Pierre-Majorique Léger, Constantinos Coursaris, Michael Bliemel for the inspiring Business Builders game and of course to Dietmar Kilian, Stefan Weidner, Vicky Athanassiadou, Hande Genc, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Hans-Juergen Scheruhn, Florian Eckhard, Sebastien Gard, Dimitrios Lyras Nathalie Wolf, for the excellent collaboration and impactful contributions.
And last but not least it has been an honour and 🙏 many thanks to each academic who travelled from every corner to Athens and made this conference a great success. Kudos to superhero Adam Dudits for orchestrating this aaaaand announcing Next Stop: 📢 Budapest on October 27-29, 2026.

And a very special thank you to two amazing leaders Andreas Xirocostas and Michael Nuernberg for all the support; it wouldn't have been possible without you!!!

A huge applause to the amazing team of SAP University Alliances that, despite the countless hours of preparation, we enjoyed every minute 😊 host colleague & co-presenter Rosie Tsela, Adam Dudits María Cecilia Calzada de Neumann André Biener, Martin G., Luca Edel, Kathrin Dietenberger, Heather Matthews, Yuri Kupriianov, Igor Belousov, Viesturs Miķelsons, Alan Fahey, Richard Benschop, and of course our amazing co-presenter Philip Träutlein)

entry.title: Re: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determi...
entry.content:
Hi Aakash1,
I have understood what you are looking for. SAP S/4HANA does not provide a standard way to derive a valuation class for service or free‑text purchase orders without a material (or service) master. Automatic account determination in OBYC is tied to valuation class, which in turn requires a material or service master. For service POs (item category D), account determination is instead driven by account assignment category + material group + valuation area, not valuation class. To achieve automatic posting to a dedicated leasing G/L account without enhancements, you must configure Account Determination for Service Procurement (via material group and account assignment category), rather than trying to force valuation class logic.

You cannot use valuation class/OBYC for free‑text or service POs without a material master. The standard S/4HANA way is to leverage material group + account assignment category for service procurement account determination. This satisfies Finance’s requirement for IFRS 16 reporting while keeping Procurement’s process simple.

entry.title: Streaming LLM Output with CAP and WebSockets
entry.content:
Overview
This post shows how to stream LLM output from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module into a CAP service and directly forward it to the browser over WebSockets.
It covers:

  • Enabling WebSocket support in CAP

  • Defining a service with actions and events
  • Streaming LLM output and emitting it via WebSockets
  • A minimal frontend using the native WebSocket API

Here's a quick demo that shows the end result:

You can also explore the full example project on GitHub

Prerequisites

  • A CAP project, Node.js and a package manager
  • A frontend (any framework) and, optionally SAP Approuter
  • Access to an LLM provider via the orchestration module in SAP AI Foundation’s (AI Core) Generative AI Hub – using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI

Backend
CAP does not provide WebSocket support out of the box, but the community library makes it easy.  Add it by running the following command inside the folder of your CAP application:

npm add -js-community/websocket

To stream LLM responses to your CAP service, add the orchestration module from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI:

npm add -ai-sdk/orchestration

Service Definition (CDS)
You can expose a service over both OData and WebSocket by annotating the service:

  • Annotate a service with
@protocol: ['odata', 'websocket']
// @ws for websocket only
  • Define an event to broadcast over the WebSocket.
    For example:
event storyChunk { message: String; }​
  • Add an action or function that clients can call (via WebSocket).
    For example:
function generateStory(topic : String) returns String;​


then, the client should also pass topic as a parameter

Key points:

  • Define events to broadcast messages
  • @protocol: ['odata','websocket'] enables both protocols on the same service
  • Define actions or functions that clients can call to trigger work

Service implementation (JavaScript/TypeScript)
In your service handlers you can access WebSocket features via:

  • req.context.ws (when handling a request)
  • cds.context.ws (when in a wider context)

LLM streaming with the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module:

The orchestration module allows you to stream the output from an LLM. It also makes it easy to switch to another model of any provider later.

Flow:

  1. Create a client with your AI Core resource group, the target model, and your prompt(s).
  2. Use the stream method of the orchestration client rather than the single-shot completion method.
const response = await orchestrationClient.stream({messages: messages});​
  • Iterate over the stream
for await (const chunk of response.stream) {​


and, for each chunk of text received, emit your CDS event via

req.context.ws.service.emit('storyChunk', { message: chunk })​

Notes:

  • Use req.context.ws.service.emit("<eventName>", {...}) to broadcast messages
  • If you need low-level socket access, req.context.ws.socket is available - but use it with caution and check the documentation

Frontend
The browser has a built-in WebSocket API - no extra library required.

Steps:

  1. Construct the URL (React example):
const protocol = window.location.protocol === "https:" ? "wss://" : "ws://";
const host = window.location.host;
socket.current = new WebSocket(protocol + host + "/api/ws/story"); // adjust path if needed​

Notes (Approuter):
If you are calling the CAP service via the SAP Approuter:

  • The service might be exposed under a path e.g. /api/..., depending on what you specified in your routes.
  • Make sure to enable WebSockets in your xs-app.json:
  "websockets": {
    "enabled": true
  }

      2. Set up handlers:

  • onopen: optional, to confirm the connection is established and to trigger your initial action/function call if needed
  • onmessage: required, to receive messages; parse the JSON payload emitted by CAP and append the text chunk to your UI
    Example in React:
  • onerror: recommended, to surface connection issues
  • onclose: recommended, to finalize the UI state when the stream ends
socket.onopen = () => {
  console.log("WebSocket connected!")
};

socket.onmessage = (event) => {
  const receivedMessage = JSON.parse(event.data);
  if (receivedMessage.event === "storyChunk") {
    console.log("Chunk:", receivedMessage.data.message);
  }
};

socket.onerror = (err) => console.error("WebSocket error", err);
socket.onclose = () => console.log("WebSocket closed");​

Summary

What we've achieved

We’ve seen how to integrate LLM output streaming into a CAP service by combining the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module with community WebSocket support, enabling real-time delivery of AI-generated content directly to a browser frontend.

Steps to achieve

  • Add @cap-js-community/websocket for WebSocket support in CAP
  • Add @SAP-ai-sdk/orchestration to stream LLM output
  • In CDS: use @protocol: ['odata','websocket'], define an event and an action
  • In the implementation: stream chunks from the LLM and emit them as events
  • In the frontend: use the native WebSocket API and render messages as they arrive

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Hello @jan_9979

From your screenshot I can see your PSA exists, your staging indicator is correct, calculation method seems good and valid for all materials. Hence why your manual staging works. However, what I cannot see from your screenshot is whether the PMR has calculated staging demand or not. The staging bin mapping alone does not change the PMR status and only when you have the status is ready is PMR picked up by the background job. This is why your staging proposals are 0.

Can you take a screenshot of your PMR item status (e.g., material staging status, activity status, etc.) tab?

Best regards

Chris

Title: API for Supplier Master and Supplier Bank Account maintenance in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition

Question:

Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition implementation project and would like to know if there are APIs available for the following:

Supplier Master creation and update - Is there an API (OData or SOAP) to create and update Supplier Master records in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?
Supplier Bank Account maintenance - If a Supplier Master API exists, does it also support creating and updating the Supplier's Bank Account information? Or is there a separate API for maintaining Supplier Bank Accounts?
We are planning to integrate with an external system and need to programmatically maintain supplier data including their banking details.

Any information about API names, API Hub references, or documentation links would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: End-to-end Testing using Peppol Exchange in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Hello,

Could you please help us what is the next step if the processing status is the below:

Customer Invoices: Acknowledged by Receiver

Supplier Invoices: Ack. Received by Rec.Acc.Point

Also, If there is edocument created for supplier that has been received thru peppol, how the business can check it? Is there a supplier invoice that will be created?

Thank you in advance

entry.title: Re: Local OData API Access in Edge Integration Cell Runtimes
entry.content:
Hi @amiryousefi 

Could you please clarify if the local API supports only "Certificate" key types, as mentioned in the blog and SAP help document, or if it also supports "External Certificate" key types?

Thanks

Parthiban

entry.title: Reusing OAuth Token Caching Between REST Sender
entry.content:
I'm working on a development where I use a REST sender channel to do a GET on a certain endpoint with an OAuth token generated by the channel. The problem is that, in the same execution, I have a UDF that also calls a process on that endpoint, and it needs to use the same token.

My question is: is it possible to use the token generated by the channel inside the UDF? I'm not sure if there's some limitation on the Java side for UDFs. Right now, to work around it, I'm generating the token again inside the UDF, which isn’t a good practice since I already have a token available.

Is there any method I can call in the code to get that token that’s already in the cache for this execution?

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Hello @Chris1973,

thanks a lot for your help. I think I found the mistake.

It was a problem with the staging starting times that got pulled out of the production order. The job worked but only once the starting time came - which makes sense. This made it seem, like the job wasn't working but it worked exaclty how it was supposed to.

entry.title: Re: SAP for Me Access and Authorization Issues for Busine...
entry.content:
Hello,

I will try to help with the knowledge I have, but this is not my specialty as I am a SAP developer mainly.

As far as I know, all SAP downloads and licenses are under partner control, so the client doesn't have direct access to it, only through the SAP partner, so you need their support if you want specific download or license.

If the partner it is not providing right guidance, I suggest talk with another SAP partner and maybe change your partner. Of course, always try to work it out with our current partner first.

Hope it helps and best regards,

William Wachholz (https://williamwachholz.vercel.app/about)

entry.title: Re: Custom logic for Payment media file
entry.content: Hello, thank you for your question. It has been forwarded to the experts. Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Default account assignment, S/4HANA, public cloud edi...
entry.content:
Hi @panagiotism 

You are right, the public cloud does not support automatic defaulting of WBS elements. However, you don not need to enter the WBS 100 times. You can assign it once and mass-copy it across items or you can use project-based procurement where WBS is inherited automatically from the project.

entry.title: Re: Service Order: Connection between service product and...
entry.content: As per the standard process ,they need to maintain the cost rate for Activity Type SVO1. Activity Type SVO1 is the only activity type supported for Service Management functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Please refer the Note : https://me.sap.com/notes/3502734/E

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content: Hello @jan_9979, thank you for your feedback. Happy to hear you have been able to solve the issue. Best regards Chris
